answerText: Montana[10] This city, Montana's most populous, is located in the Yellowstone Valley and known as the "Magic City."
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Rutgers-NB + St. Johns A + Haverford | 20 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: This U.S. state is the only state in the Union not to have a modern ship named after it in the United States navy and has a population of just over one million people. For 10 points each: [10] Name this U.S. state, the fourth largest in the country by land area, that borders Wyoming, Idaho, and both Dakotas, and is known as "Big Sky Country."
